Description: Scarab carved from steatite; underside with incised decoration representing an opened lotus flower.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Chautauqua Institution, New York. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

This scarab is lost. Brief description ('scarab, steatite, lotus flower') with sketch from Chautauqua distribution list of the Egypt Exploration Fund. It is possible to identify the scarab with Petrie 1886, pl. XXXVIII no. 155. This motif finds several parallels, mainly dated between the 22nd and 25th dynasty: Keel 2010, 400-1, no. 887 (dated between the 22nd and 25th dynasty); Keel 2013, 660-1, no. 2 (dated to the 22nd dynasty). Keel, O. 2010, Corpus der Stempelsiegel-Amulette aus Palästina/Israel : von den Anfängen bis zur Perserzeit, Orbis biblicus et orientalis, Series Archaeologica 31, Fribourg. Keel, O. 2013, Corpus der Stempelsiegel-Amulette aus Palästina/Israel : von den Anfängen bis zur Perserzeit, Orbis biblicus et orientalis, Series Archaeologica 33, Fribourg. Petrie, W.M.F. 1886, Naukratis. Part I, 1884–5 (Third Memoir of the Egypt Exploration Fund), London.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXVIII, no. 155)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (OA.38) (phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Chautauqua Institution, Chautauqua (NY)
